txt.en: 'I feared that outcome, but am grateful for the truth. I vow to find whoever killed my wife and father and rout the evil from this city.\n\n'It is time my advisors and I discuss our plan. We must discover who was behind the attack and reclaim my seat in the mead hall. If I returned now, I feel it might become my tomb, as it almost did before.'
Herubrand is in the cellar of the farmhouse.\n\nThe council meeting has ended, and Herubrand wishes to speak with you.
Herubrand has decided to meet with his council to discuss what should be done in the aftermath of the attack on the mead hall of Woodhurst.
'The advisors are on their way here, and the council meeting should begin in a few moments.'

'I believe I may trust the council, as they were always loyal to my father, Heremond. However, I have doubts regarding some of their motivations.

'Arnwi's observation about the missing guards is very troubling. Had they been there to help, my family might still live.

'Nevertheless, I believe that speaking with the guards who remain at their posts will yield our best chance of discovering the source of the attack.'
Herubrand is in the cellar of the farmhouse near the farm fields of Woodhurst.\n\nHerubrand is gathering his advisors for a council meeting, at which you should be present.
